original: Anjou, Sten Gustav Anton, fil. dr, arkitekt, Göteborg, f. 10/1/95 i Sthlm av v. här:hövd. Anton A. o. Flora Nordenskjöld. G. 2. 36 m. Åsa Lindström. Barn: Agneta f. 37, Kristina 38, Klas 41, Karl 44. — Stud:ex. v. h. a. 1. å Östermalm i Sthlm 13, avg:ex. fr. KTH 17, stud. v. KKH 20-22, v. Sthlms högsk. 20-21 o. 25, v. univ. i Lund 22-24, fil. kand. 24, fil. lic. 25, fil. dr 30. Arkit:hist. stud. i Danm. 26 o. i Tyskl. 30. Aman. v. Röhsska konstslöjdmus. i Gbg sed. 23. Utf. vet:skapl. und:sökn. o. utgrävn. av HeHgkorskyrkan i Dalby 19, Glim-mingehus 25, Vårfrukyrkan i Roskilde 26, medeltidspalats i Bollerup 26 o. 33, restaurer. av Glimmingehus 25-26, kyrkoruiner i Njurunda o. Selånger 29-31, Heligkorskyrkan i Dalby 36, utf. inredn:arb. i Röhsska konstslöjdmus. Skr.: Heliga Korsets kyrka i Dalby samt de äldsta kyrkorna i Lund, Roskilde o. Odense (grad:avh. 30) samt ett 30-tal vet:skapl. upps. i konst- ü. kulturhist. tidskr. o. publ., upps. i po-puL.tidskr. o. dagspress, håll. föredr. om konst.
translated:
Anjou, Sten Gustav Anton, Ph.D., architect, Gothenburg, b. January 10, 1895 in Stockholm to Captain Anton A. and Flora Nordenskjöld. He married Åsa Lindström in 1936, and they had four children: Agneta (b. 1937), Kristina (b. 1938), Klas (b. 1941), and Karl (b. 1944). He completed his secondary school education at Östermalm in Stockholm in 1913, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1917, studied at the Royal Swedish Academy of Fine Arts from 1920-1922, and at Stockholm University in 1920-1921 and 1925, and at the University of Lund from 1922-1924. He received his Bachelor's degree in 1924, his Master's degree in 1925, and his doctoral degree in 1930. He studied architectural history in Denmark in 1926 and in Germany in 1930.

He was an assistant at the Röhsska Museum of Decorative Arts in Gothenburg from 1923, carrying out research and excavations at the Holy Cross Church in Dalby in 1919, Glimmingehus Castle in 1925, Our Lady's Church in Roskilde in 1926, medieval palaces in Bollerup in 1926 and 1933, and the ruins of churches in Njurunda and Selånger from 1929-1931. He also undertook restoration work at Glimmingehus Castle from 1925-1926 and at the Holy Cross Church in Dalby in 1936. He carried out interior work at the Röhsska Museum of Decorative Arts. He authored the book Holy Cross Church in Dalby as well as the oldest churches in Lund, Roskilde and Odense (doctoral thesis, 1930), and about thirty scientific papers on art and cultural history in specialized publications, and articles in popular magazines and newspapers, and also held lectures on art.

structured.description: Architect and scholar of architectural history known for his restoration work and research on churches and medieval palaces in Sweden and Denmark. Authored several papers and a book on art and cultural history.
